remarks: If the topology of ` R ` is Hausdorff, Cauchy sequences have at most one limit, i.e. the canonical homomorphism of ` RR ` into ` R ` is a function.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 2-Nov-2017.)
statement:
rrhf.d $e |- D = ( ( dist ` R ) |` ( B X. B ) ) $.
rrhf.j $e |- J = ( topGen ` ran (,) ) $.
rrhf.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
rrhf.k $e |- K = ( TopOpen ` R ) $.
rrhf.z $e |- Z = ( ZMod ` R ) $.
rrhf.1 $e |- ( ph -> R e. DivRing ) $.
rrhf.2 $e |- ( ph -> R e. NrmRing ) $.
rrhf.3 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. NrmMod ) $.
rrhf.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( chr ` R ) = 0 ) $.
rrhf.5 $e |- ( ph -> R e. CUnifSp ) $.
rrhf.6 $e |- ( ph -> ( UnifSt ` R ) = ( metUnif ` D ) ) $.
rrhf $p |- ( ph -> ( RRHom ` R ) : RR --> B ) $.
